title: Exponential Depreciation Formula
text: We have the exponential decay formula $$V=V0 \left(1+r\right)^t$$

title: Value Given
text: We are given that: Initial value (V0): $$38000$$, Value in $$2013$$ (V): $$11000$$, Time elapsed (2007 to 2013)(t): $$6$$ years.

title: Substitute the Value
text: Plug in the values, we get $$11000=38000\left(1+r\right)^6$$

title: Solve the Equation
text: What is the value of $$r$$? (Round to the $$3$$ decimal places)

title: Project the Value to $$2017$$
text: Now, apply the same depreciation rate for the next $$4$$ years (2013 to 2017). The total time from $$2007$$ to $$2017$$ is $$10$$ years, but we'll use the $$2013$$ value as the new starting point: $$V2017=11000\left(1-0.167\right)^4$$
